description: From Old French anoncier, from Latin annūntiāre, from ad + nūntiō (“report, relate”), from nūntius (“messenger, bearer of news”). See nuncio, and compare with annunciate.

verbs.description: announce (third-person singular simple present announces, present participle announcing, simple past and past participle announced)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give public notice, especially for the first time; to make known.
examples: Her [Queen Elizabeth’s] arrival was announced through the country by a peal of cannon from the ramparts.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To pronounce; to declare by judicial sentence.
examples: Publish laws, announce / Or life or death.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To act as announcer for (an event, usually sports).
examples: Our coach has retired, but occasionally he still announces the games.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To act or work as an announcer.
examples: Our coach has retired, but occasionally he still announces.
